benchmark_details.name: MARBLE (MultimodAl Reasoning Benchmark for Language modEls)
benchmark_details.overview: MARBLE is a challenging multimodal reasoning benchmark designed to evaluate multimodal language models (MLLMs) on their ability to reason through complex spatial problems with step-by-step planning under diverse constraints.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate MLLMs on complex multimodal reasoning tasks involving step-by-step planning in spatial and physical problem constraints.

data.source: Portal 2 community test chambers for M-Portal, synthetic generation for M-Cube.
data.annotation: Human annotation by expert annotators for M-Portal, synthetic generation for M-Cube.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of proposed plans and solutions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores on F1 and accuracy indicate better performance on reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance expressed as F1 score and accuracy was compared against random baseline.
